definition: a while/a spell/a short time/a burst
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
disposition of troops/wave/spate/burst/spell/short period of time/classifier for events or states of short duration

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: For starters, it's being held in the gymnasium at Valley High School, a few miles from the Strip.
sentences.chinese: 訓練在山谷高中已經有一陣子，距離繁華區有幾英里。

sentences.english: He is down with a nasty bout of flu.
sentences.chinese: 他患了一陣子感冒，很難受。

sentences.english: Live in Northern California once, but leave before it makes you soft.
sentences.chinese: 去北加州住一陣子，但在心神松懶前搬走。

sentences.english: We had some fun and games a few months ago.
sentences.chinese: 幾個月前我們大玩了一陣子。

sentences.english: There was a few minutes that the aircraft was down down and feeling like free-fall.
sentences.chinese: 有一陣子一直往下掉，感覺就像自由落體一樣。

sentences.english: When it comes to reproduction, men will still have it easier for some time.
sentences.chinese: 談起繁衍來，男人還能優哉遊哉一陣子。

sentences.english: Jo and Sam decided to try living apart for a while.
sentences.chinese: 喬與薩姆決定試着分開住一陣子。

sentences.english: That could be for a while for any reasons.
sentences.chinese: 可能因爲各種原因要等一陣子。

sentences.english: For a while, making baby ah to squeeze out a few words in his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 好一陣子，嘴裏咿咿呀呀地擠出幾個字。

sentences.english: The candle sputtered for a moment.
sentences.chinese: 蠟燭劈劈啪啪響了一陣子。

sentences.english: The ship drifted helplessly for a time.
sentences.chinese: 那艘船孤零無依地漂泊了一陣子。

sentences.english: Hopefully we won't need to do another one like that for a while.
sentences.chinese: 但願這一陣子不用再來一次像這樣的。

sentences.english: After a while neighbors and kin just let her hoe.
sentences.chinese: 過了一陣子，鄰居和親屬們也就不再攔着她了。

sentences.english: Chen has thought about giving up, too, but for now he's sticking with tilapia.
sentences.chinese: 陳也想過放棄，但目前來講他還是想堅持一陣子。

sentences.english: "Butter is awful dear these days, " he suggested.
sentences.chinese: “這一陣子黃油可是貴得嚇人，”他暗示道。

sentences.english: TYPICAL USE:That pop-song had a great vogue at one time.
sentences.chinese: 那首通俗歌曲有一陣子非常流行。

definition: a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
a moment/a while/in a moment/now...now.../also pr. [yi1 hui3 r5]
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
